params.failureRuleIndex: The index of the rule to evaluate if the evaluation of `startingRuleIndex` was false.
params.startingRuleIndex: The index of the starting rule to evaluate.
params.successRuleIndex: The index of the rule to evaluate if the evaluation of `startingRuleIndex` was true.

returns._0: The encoded value combining all three inputs.
An array of `Rule` structs representing the currently defined rules.

params._data: Optional data passed to the `PermissionCondition` implementation.
params._where: The address of the target contract.
params._who: The address (EOA or contract) for which the permissions are checked.

returns.isPermitted: Returns true if the call is permitted.

protocolVersion().details: This version number is not to be confused with the `release` and `build` numbers found in the `Version.Tag` struct inside the `PluginRepo` contract being used to version plugin setup and associated plugin implementation contracts.

returns._0: Returns the semantic Aragon OSx protocol version number.
Returns `true` if the interface is supported.

decodeRuleValue(uint256).notice: Decodes rule indices into three uint32.

encodeIfElse(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Encodes rule indices into a uint240 value.

encodeLogicalOperator(uint256,uint256).notice: Encodes two rule indexes into a uint240 value. Useful for logical operators such as `AND/OR/XOR` and others.

getRules().notice: Retrieves the current rules stored in this contract.

isGranted(address,address,bytes32,bytes).notice: Checks if a call is permitted.

protocolVersion().notice: Returns the semantic Aragon OSx protocol version number that the implementing contract is associated with.

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: Checks if an interface is supported by this or its parent contract.

documentation.text: @notice Identifier for a rule based on the current block number.
@notice Identifier for a rule based on the current timestamp.
@notice Identifier for a rule that evaluates a condition based on another condition contract.
@notice Identifier for a rule that is based on logical operations (e.g., AND, OR).
@notice Identifier for a rule that involves direct value comparison.

@notice Emitted when the rules are updated.
 @param rules The new rules that replaces old rules.
@notice A set of rules that will be used in the evaluation process.
@inheritdoc PermissionConditionUpgradeable

typeDescriptions.typeString: struct RuledCondition.Rule storage ref[] storage ref

documentation.text:
@notice Retrieves the current rules stored in this contract.
 @return An array of `Rule` structs representing the currently defined rules.
